# Discord Chat Analysis for ðŸ’»â”‚developers

## 1. Summary:
The discussion primarily focused on agent development in Hyperfy, VRM avatar implementation, and world-building features. Ashxn provided technical details about the node client for agents, explaining that it properly runs all systems regular players do, including physics and player controllers, making agents behave almost identically to human players. Jin mentioned working on "stonk market world" (https://hyperfy.io/stonkwip) and converting avatars to VRM format. Vox announced that v2 now supports screenUV video with streaming, UVscrolling, and agents. There was also discussion about documentation resources, with Ashxn pointing to both the docs folder in the repo and the community knowledge base at docs.hyperfy.xyz. The chat included sharing of examples showing flying mechanics and barrel rolls, suggesting vehicle or movement system development is progressing.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: Are the avatars shown in the Twitter link VRM? (asked by jin) A: Yes (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Should I stall working with the eliza agent starter repo? (asked by 0mka) A: No, but the dev branch has an agent.mjs file showing how to use the true node client (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is there a single place/board kept up to date with core functionality for v2? (asked by hiroP) A: The docs folder in the repo is comprehensive but technical, and https://docs.hyperfy.xyz has community knowledge (answered by Ashxn)

## 3. Help Interactions:
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: 0mka | Context: Questions about agent development and whether to use eliza agent starter repo | Resolution: Explained that the dev branch contains agent.mjs showing how to use the true node client that properly runs all systems regular players do
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: hiroP | Context: Looking for documentation on v2 functionality | Resolution: Directed to the docs folder in the repo for technical documentation and https://docs.hyperfy.xyz for community knowledge

## 4. Action Items:
Technical: Convert GitHub avatars repository to VRM format | Description: Jin needs to convert avatars from https://github.com/m3-org/avatars to VRM format | Mentioned By: jin
Feature: Complete stonk market world development | Description: Finish development of https://hyperfy.io/stonkwip | Mentioned By: jin
Documentation: Organize comprehensive v2 functionality documentation | Description: Consolidate information about what can be done in v2 | Mentioned By: hiroP

# Discord Chat Analysis

## 1. Summary
The chat segment contains minimal technical discussion. The main technical points include:
- Ashxn mentioned that the Hyperfy platform development was paused for R&D to ensure the best direction, which is now "locked in" and moving to execution phase
- Agent12 noted that since Hyperfy Core is open-source, there have been community efforts to make Hyperfy compatible with both Solana ecosystem and EVM
- There was a brief mention of documentation links, specifically that docs.hyperfy.xyz should replace the old hyperfy.how link
- AI integration was briefly mentioned as being part of Hyperfy's vision, with AI entities intended to play games and teach people in virtual worlds

The chat also included health advice about desk work, a question about platform launch timing, and general greetings.

## 2. FAQ
Q: When do you plan to launch the platform? (asked by Alexa) A: I can't give dates but it'll happen out of nowhere like most things we do here. We paused on the platform to do some RND and make sure we were going in the absolute best direction. That direction is now locked in so it's execution time. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: No ai? (asked by johan) A: It's literally in the pic haha. AI are like humans. We want them playing games and teaching people etc in every world. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Curious if the platform will be Solana or multi-chain (asked by nettuser) A: Since the Core is Open-Source there has been community efforts towards making Hyperfy usable for BOTH Solana ecosystem and EVM Compatibility. (answered by Agent12)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: Gert-Jan Akerboom | Helpee: Community | Context: Suggesting docs.hyperfy.xyz should replace the old hyperfy.how link in the link section | Resolution: Suggestion acknowledged by Valiant who noted play link is there but at bottom of page

## 4. Action Items
Type: Documentation | Description: Replace hyperfy.how link with docs.hyperfy.xyz in the link section | Mentioned By: Gert-Jan Akerboom

The chat segment is extremely brief, containing only two messages. There is no technical discussion, problem-solving, or implementation details present. One user ("general hyper") made a comment about "making money this morning" and another user ("Agent12") responded with the proverb "watched pot doesn't boil," suggesting patience regarding financial returns or market movements. No technical content or decisions were discussed in this limited exchange.
